a.title: Our Transylvania County Scholars in the Class of 2019 and their Memorable Educators, a cherished tradition for graduating seniors scholars!

img.alt: Our Transylvania County Scholars in the Class of 2019 and their Memorable Educators, a cherished tradition for graduating seniors scholars!

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

p.span: On Monday, April 6, 2020, the Transylvania County Board of Education held a regular meeting which was streamed online. The intent was to (1) provide public access to the proceedings in accordance with the NC Open Meetings Law, and (2) adhere to the governor's executive order which limits a gathering to 10 people.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

p.span: However, during the meeting the Board discovered that some viewers were not able to observe the meeting. For that we wish to apologize, and once the error was identified, the Board immediately went into recess to remedy the situation.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

p.span: As a safeguard, the meeting was recorded, and the recording of all decisions taken by the Board is made available here for all viewers. Furthermore, we will rectify this problem before any future meetings, so every member of the public may participate safely in these open and public meetings.

a.title: TCS COVID Feeding Sites, Community
a.span: Free Meals in the Community for School-Age Children

br.p:
See below for daily updates on the Coronavirus Response
by Transylvania County Schools and our community partners.

img.alt: BHS Staff Plan Emergency Feeding, March 2020

a.title: Cafeteria Staff Play Critical Role Fighting Hunger

div.a: Cafeteria Staff Play Critical Role Fighting Hunger
div.div: Our schools’ “big play” moment arrived recently when Governor Roy Cooper ordered North Carolina public schools to close, in order to help slow the spread of coronavirus infection across our state. What began as a two-week closure was later extended through May 15. In this story, we celebrate the efforts of School Nutrition Services in Transylvania County Schools to refocus their enterprise and rewrite their playbook over a hectic three days, to meet an unprecedented need for the community’s children.
div.a: Read More About Cafeteria Staff Play Critical Role Fighting Hunger

div.div: The Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA or ACT) requires certain employers to provide their employees with paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave for specified reasons related to COVID-19. These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020, through December 31, 2020.
div.a: Read More About Employee Rights—Coronavirus Response Act

img.alt: Transylvania County Schools Cancels Out-of-State Travel, March 2020

a.title: Transylvania County Schools Cancels Out-Of-State Travel

div.a: Transylvania County Schools Cancels Out-Of-State Travel
div.div: Out of concern for all our students, staff, families, and community, Transylvania County Schools has decided to cancel all out-of-state student trips effective Wednesday, March 11, 2020. This difficult decision errs on the side of caution, due to the most recent events and the governor's announcement of a state of emergency for the state of North Carolina.
div.a: Read More About Transylvania County Schools Cancels Out-Of-State Travel

img.alt: Missy Ellenberger Named CTE and High School Curriculum Director

a.title: Missy Ellenberger Named CTE and High School Curriculum Director

div.a: Missy Ellenberger Named CTE and High School Curriculum Director
div.div: Superintendent Dr. Jeff McDaris has named Missy Ellenberger as Director of Career and Technical Education (CTE) and High School Curriculum for Transylvania County Schools, effective July 1, 2020. Ellenberger most recently served as Curriculum Director for kindergarten through twelfth grade for the past year. For over 25 years, she has served Transylvania County Schools as teacher, coach, career development coordinator, assistant principal, and central office administrator.
div.a: Read More About Missy Ellenberger Named CTE and High School Curriculum Director

a.title: Region 8 EBOB, HCPSNC (Elementary Battle of the Books)

div.div: Region 8 EBOB, HCPSNC (Elementary Battle of the Books)

The Board of Education meeting for April 6 is broadcast online. Read the update for a link to view a live stream. Meals will be served through Thursday, April 9, and resume April 20 after Spring Break. Supplemental food is being sent home on a specified day for each area this week. Read for details to prepare for a delivery of extra food.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 17 - April 6, 2020

div.div: In this update: link for Monday's online school board meeting, nutrition and academics updates, Virtual Spirit Week, and more.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 16 - April 5, 2020

a.title: COVID-19 Update 15 - March 30 - “Stay At Home” Order Takes Effect

div.a: COVID-19 Update 15 - March 30 - “Stay At Home” Order Takes Effect
div.div: We have settled into our Virtual Day schedule through May 15. Over the last two weeks, we have refined our delivery of meals and academics, and now we are set to stay the course. According to Governor Cooper’s most recent order, everyone in the state should “Stay At Home” except for essential business, starting today, March 30, at 5pm.
div.a: Read More About COVID-19 Update 15 - March 30 - “Stay At Home” Order Takes Effect

a.title: website_assistance
a.p: Let Us Know How We Can Help You

div.p:
Transylvania County Schools welcomes you to the first choice for education in prekindergarten through twelfth grade—the innovative, traditional public schools of our community since 1861.
Our mission is to prepare students to become caring and productive citizens in an ever-changing society, through the shared responsibility of students, parents, educators, and the community.
Our motto is "Teaching everyone takes everyone." We ask you to join us in committing to our highest values—that all children can learn; however they learn differently, and we must value and understand those differences, and that minds and hearts are the focus of education.
Learn more about the mission, vision, goals, and values of Transylvania County Schools.

div.span: Website by SchoolMessenger Presence. © 2020 Intrado Corporation. All rights reserved.
